Product General Manager, responsible for PNL, marketing, sales/customer success, strategy and execution of 3-year product roadmap for digital and hands-on learning and practice growth programs. •  Recently managed the roll-out of a new beta-proven PaaS product set to formally begin in January, 2018 with membership capped at 100 the first year to optimize the customer experience; the soft-launch resulted in over 120 reservation confirmations out of a room of 140 potential members (86% conversion) well exceeding the first year goal 3.5 months before the formal program start. Work product ranged from creation of a formal go-to-market plan with a feature roadmap to content and platform/web development backed by product marketing strategy and execution. •  Launched new product feature to increase meeting attendance and days to close via customer-facing drip campaign and analytics dashboard; average days to close reduced by +60%•  Collaborated with finance executives on monthly pricing strategy resulting in significant business-line revenue increase over annual subscription pricing. •  Implemented company’s first go-to-market plan resulting in a record-breaking year for new customers, up over 20% from prior year, with increase of >10bps in retention despite price increases.

Researched, analyzed, and mapped the customer journey to create a framework for customer lifecycle. Identified short-, and long-term customer experience improvement initiatives based on data analysis and observed trends. Defined success metrics, managed project improved and communicated to senior leaders.•  Serving as a customer advocate, recommended/reviewed content and experiences, and initiated improvements to guarantee positive customer interactions.•  Researched and implemented customer segments used companywide to better understand and personalize customer experiences.

Product owner responsible for revenue and KPIs on GoDaddy.com and digital commerce channels, directing acquisition, customer experience, conversion and optimization initiatives. Directed cart/checkout functions and mobile site/applications. •  Launched the company’s first localized website for emerging markets, leading from project definition to vendor selection and hiring through to optimization.•  Led the migration from static to dynamic personalized product recommendations in the shopping cart, increasing cart revenues per visit by 90%.•  Increased mobile site conversion rates by +32bps in six months (+5bps goal) by redesigning the mobile checkout process, and integrating a credit card scanner.•  Promoted from Website Marketing Manager in 2008 after successfully managing the site conversion from .ASP to .NET; brought several disconnected sites under one navigation.

Managed marketing campaigns and programs for multiple technology categories on Intel.com, including Embedded, and Communications. Defined creative strategies, drove execution, and communicated campaign outcomes using internal/external agencies to deliver best-in-class online experiences.

Accountable for messaging, content creation, and marketing plans for the multi-million-dollar Modular Communications Platform; used cross-channel participation with stakeholders to evangelize through key channels. Managed/designed division intranet sites, co-marketing programs with ecosystem partners including HP, and events targeted at telecom equipment manufacturers, service providers, media, and industry analysts promoting the product line.

September 27, 2015, Shannon worked with Nicole in the same group

Shannon is one of my favorite people I've ever worked with. I had the pleasure of being on the same team as Shannon, and what struck me right away when I first started working with her was her commitment to the customer experience and how supportive and helpful she was to myself and our team. In particular, her excellent project management skills made daunting volumes of work so much more manageable, and directly contributed to our overall business success. From a product management standpoint, Shannon was both an amazing partner to the business groups she worked with and liaison to the technical teams. She was able to translate often complex business requirements and work with the development resources to produce innovative experience. And she did all of this with such a positive and fun attitude that made it a true joy to work with her. I would love the opportunity to work with Shannon again in a heartbeat, and highly recommend her as an addition to any "dream team"!

Retired, Marketing Communication Mgr,
September 24, 2015, Lili Gilmartin was senior to Shannon but didn’t manage directly

:I was a Marketing Communications Manager at Microchip Technology for 8 years, supporting 5 divsions. During this period of rapid growth and expansion, I had the pleasure and privilege of working with Shannon Schumacher. Shannon was exceptional in so many ways. She could quickly discern the unique characteristics of a division's product and from that knowledge develop strategic advertising and promotional plans, all the while keeping a close eye on budgets. Shannon consistently exceeded expectations. For example, I was setting up a large booth at an out-of-town tradeshow when I discovered that one of our wall-sized graphics had been damaged in shipping. Although it was closing time in Arizona, Shannon was able to contact a vendor near the venue, send them the electronic files and arrange for print out and delivery of my graphics before show opening the next morning. Shannon also showed exceptional initiative on a daily basis. For example, on her own time and at her own expense, she attended training workshops to improve her Photoshop skills for the benefit of the Company. I could easily ramble on with additional examples, but suffice it to say, Shannon is one of those rare individuals who combines the best of talent, creativity and exceptional work ethics.

April 22, 2015, Shannon worked with Joshua in the same group

Shannon was easily the best marketer that I had the privilege of working with at GoDaddy. As the lead developer of the mobile ecommerce team, I heavily relied on Shannon to provide direction on execution of the website. Any time I had questions on experience and revenue decisions for the website, Shannon was always quick to help. She made swift decisions that directly led to increased revenue for our team consistently. Shannon always stood up for me as a developer and defended my development decisions. She was easily able to compromise with development constraints and come up with optimal solutions that worked for the whole team.Our team worked with the Agile model and Shannon was critical to our success with that. She wrote clear and concise user stories and she was quick to answer questions about any confusion with priority.Not only is Shannon a great employee, she's also a great person. She brings a great, positive energy to the work environment. I don't see how it would be possible for someone to not get along with her. I hope that I get the opportunity to work with her again in the future.

summary: As a passionate, results-driven product management and marketing leader, I am adept at driving profitable go-to-market strategies while influencing teams to unexpected outcomes. I am a digital commerce and SaaS expert with a passion for cultivating exceptional product experiences and solutions. I drive towards and maintain a constant focus on customer innovation resulting in long-term growth, ROI, retention and loyalty.  I perform best in a high-growth, technology-focused environment.Core competencies:Leadership | Product Management |  Product Development | Product Strategy | Agile | Ecommerce |Marketing | Forecasting and Analysis | Customer Success | Program Management | SaaS | PaaS | Revenue Management | Lifecycle | Reporting/Analytics | Communication | Strategic Partnerships | Agile Methodologies | Customer Experience | Advocacy | Acquisition/Retention | Campaign Management | Localization and Internationalization | Optimization/Testing | Mobile Development | Team Building/Management | Learn more about me by downloading my resume or email me at Shannon@shannonschumacher.com for more information.
name: Shannon Schumacher
title: Product Management and Marketing Executive
